column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/d4e1c61212c3f28f80c7184aca81f5d118fad460 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
@laanwj Any reason not to pull this (checking my open commits for progress currently)?\n
This doesn't look correct. You shouldn't call MapPort at all if USE_UPNP is not set.\n

There are three settings for USE_PNP:
- `#undef USE_UPNP`: no libupnpc compiled in at all
- `#define USE_UPNP 0`: libupnp compiled in, but defaults to off
- `#define USE_UPNP 1`: libupnp compiled in, and defaults to on
We have an empty dummy function that is called if USE_UPNP is not set (in net.cpp).\n
If USE_UPNP is defined, we default to true, all other cases (even if no libupnpc was compiled in) should be false, IMO this should be working?\n

No - USE_UPNP can be defined and be either 0 or 1, depending on whether it should be enabled by default or not. So this should be:

``` c++
static const bool DEFAULT_UPNP = USE_UPNP;
```

Yeah, will change this then...

Edit: Changed!
